adminPassword.description: Initial admin password used to authenticate to Anchore.

database.description: Database name to connect to on host (Note: database name CANNOT contain hyphens).

feeds_database.description: Feeds database name to connect to on host (Note: feeds database name CANNOT contain hyphens). Only required for enterprise edition of anchore. By default, feeds database will be configured with the same username and password as the main database. For formatting examples on how to use a separate username and password for the feeds database see https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/security-tools/anchore-enterprise/-/blob/main/docs/CHART.md#handling-dependencies

host.description: Hostname of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Anchore. Entering connection info will disable the deployment of an internal database and will auto-create any required secrets.

password.description: Database password for the username used to connect to the existing database.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Anchore.

username.description: Username to connect as to external database, the user must have all privileges on the database.

enabled.description: Toggle the installation of Anchore Enterprise.  This must be accompanied by a valid license.

licenseYaml.description: License for Anchore Enterprise. For formatting examples see https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/security-tools/anchore-enterprise/-/blob/main/docs/CHART.md#enabling-enterprise-services

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Anchore Package

host.description: Hostname of a pre-existing Redis to use for Anchore Enterprise. Entering connection info will enable external redis and will auto-create any required secrets. Anchore only requires redis for enterprise deployments and will not provision an instance if using external

password.description: Password to connect to pre-existing Redis.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing Redis to use for Anchore Enterprise.

username.description: OPTIONAL: Username to connect to a pre-existing Redis (for password-only auth leave empty)

enabled.description: Toggle OIDC SSO for Anchore on and off. Enabling this option will auto-create any required secrets (Note: SSO requires an Enterprise license).

values.description: Values to passthrough to the anchore chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/security-tools/anchore-enterprise.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the ArgoCD Package

enabled.description: Toggle SSO for ArgoCD on and off

groups.description: ArgoCD SSO group roles, see docs for more details: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/rbac/

values.description: Values to passthrough to the argocd chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/argocd.git

enabled.description: Toggle deployment of Authservice. if enabling authservice, a filter needs to be provided by either enabling sso for monitoring or istio, or manually adding a filter chain in the values here: values:   chain:     minimal:       callback_uri: "https://somecallback"

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Authservice Package

values.description: Values to passthrough to the authservice chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/authservice.git

database.description: Database name to connect to on host.

host.description: Hostname of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Gitlab. Entering connection info will disable the deployment of an internal database and will auto-create any required secrets.

password.description: Database password for the username used to connect to the existing database.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Gitlab.

username.description: Username to connect as to external database, the user must have all privileges on the database.

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Gitlab Package

accessKey.description: Access key for connecting to object storage endpoint.

accessSecret.description: Secret key for connecting to object storage endpoint. Unencoded string data. This should be placed in the secret values and then encrypted

bucketPrefix.description: Bucket prefix to use for identifying buckets. Example: "prod" will produce "prod-gitlab-bucket"

endpoint.description: S3 compatible endpoint to use for connection information. examples: "https://s3.amazonaws.com" "https://s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com" "http://minio.minio.svc.cluster.local:9000"

region.description: S3 compatible region to use for connection information.

type.description: Type of object storage to use for Gitlab, setting to s3 will assume an external, pre-existing object storage is to be used. Entering connection info will enable this option and will auto-create any required secrets

enabled.description: Toggle OIDC SSO for Gitlab on and off. Enabling this option will auto-create any required secrets.

values.description: Values to passthrough to the gitlab chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/developer-tools/gitlab.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Gitlab Runner Package

values.description: Values to passthrough to the gitlab runner chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/developer-tools/gitlab-runner.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the HAProxy Package

values.description: Values to passthrough to the haproxy chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/sandbox/haproxy.git

database.description: Database name to connect to on host.

host.description: Hostname of a pre-existing database to use for Keycloak. Entering connection info will disable the deployment of an internal database and will auto-create any required secrets.

password.description: Database password for the username used to connect to the existing database.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing database to use for Keycloak.

type.description: Pre-existing database type (e.g. postgres) to use for Keycloak.

username.description: Username to connect as to external database, the user must have all privileges on the database.

enabled.description: Toggle deployment of Keycloak. if you enable Keycloak you should uncomment the istio passthrough configurations above istio.ingressGateways.passthrough-ingressgateway and istio.gateways.passthrough

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the OPA Gatekeeper Package

key.description: Certificate/Key pair to use as the certificate for exposing Keycloak Setting the ingress cert here will automatically create the volume and volumemounts in the Keycloak Package chart

values.description: Values to passthrough to the keycloak chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/security-tools/keycloak.git

database.description: Database name to connect to on host.

host.description: Hostname of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Mattermost. Entering connection info will disable the deployment of an internal database and will auto-create any required secrets.

password.description: Database password for the username used to connect to the existing database.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for Mattermost.

ssl_mode.description: SSL Mode to use when connecting to the database. Allowable values for this are viewable in the postgres documentation: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-ssl.html#LIBPQ-SSL-SSLMODE-STATEMENTS

username.description: Username to connect as to external database, the user must have all privileges on the database.

enabled.description: Toggle interaction with Elastic for optimized search indexing

elasticsearch.description: Mattermost Elasticsearch integration - requires enterprise E20 license - https://docs.mattermost.com/deployment/elasticsearch.html Connection info defaults to the BB deployed Elastic, all values can be overridden via the "values" passthrough for other connections. See values spec in MM chart "elasticsearch" yaml block - https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/collaboration-tools/mattermost/-/blob/main/chart/values.yaml

enabled.description: Toggle the Mattermost Enterprise.  This must be accompanied by a valid license unless you plan to start a trial post-install.

license.description: License for Mattermost. This should be the entire contents of the license file from Mattermost (should be one line), example below license: "eyJpZCI6InIxM205bjR3eTdkYjludG95Z3RiOD---REST---IS---HIDDEN

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Mattermost Package

accessKey.description: Access key for connecting to object storage endpoint.

accessSecret.description: Secret key for connecting to object storage endpoint. Unencoded string data. This should be placed in the secret values and then encrypted

bucket.description: Bucket name to use for Mattermost - will be auto-created.

endpoint.description: S3 compatible endpoint to use for connection information. Entering connection info will enable this option and will auto-create any required secrets. examples: "s3.amazonaws.com" "s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com" "minio.minio.svc.cluster.local:9000"

auth_endpoint.description: Mattermost OIDC auth endpoint To get endpoint values, see here: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/collaboration-tools/mattermost/-/blob/main/docs/keycloak.md#helm-values

enabled.description: Toggle OIDC SSO for Mattermost on and off. Enabling this option will auto-create any required secrets.

token_endpoint.description: Mattermost OIDC token endpoint To get endpoint values, see here: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/collaboration-tools/mattermost/-/blob/main/docs/keycloak.md#helm-values

user_api_endpoint.description: Mattermost OIDC user API endpoint To get endpoint values, see here: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/collaboration-tools/mattermost/-/blob/main/docs/keycloak.md#helm-values

values.description: Values to passthrough to the Mattermost chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/collaboration-tools/mattermost/-/blob/main/chart/values.yaml

accesskey.description: Default access key to use for minio.

secretkey.description: Default secret key to intstantiate with minio, you should change/delete this after installation.

values.description: Values to passthrough to the minio instance chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/application-utilities/minio.git

enabled.description: Toggle deployment of minio operator and instance.

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Nexus Repository Manager Package

enabled.description: Toggle SAML SSO for NXRM. -- handles SAML SSO, a Client must be configured in Keycloak or IdP -- to complete setup. -- https://support.sonatype.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500000976522-SAML-integration-for-Nexus-Repository-Manager-Pro-3-and-Nexus-IQ-Server-with-Keycloak#h_01EV7CWCYH3YKAPMAHG8XMQ599

idpMetadata.description: IDP SAML Metadata XML as a single line string in single quotes -- this information is public and does not require a secret

username.description: IdP Field Mappings -- NXRM username attribute

values.description: Values to passthrough to the nxrm chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/sandbox/nexus.git

password.description: Database password for the username used to connect to the existing database.

port.description: Port of a pre-existing PostgreSQL database to use for SonarQube.

username.description: Username to connect as to external database, the user must have all privileges on the database.

certificate.description: SonarQube plaintext SAML sso certificate. example: MITCAYCBFyIEUjNBkqhkiG9w0BA....

privateKey.description: SSH git credentials, privateKey, publicKey, and knownHosts must be provided

username.description: HTTP git credentials, both username and password must be provided

credentials.description: Chart created secrets with user defined values

existingSecret.description: Existing secret to use for git credentials, must be in the appropriate format: https://toolkit.fluxcd.io/components/source/gitrepositories/#https-authentication

git.description: Git credential settings for accessing private repositories Order of precedence is:   1. existingSecret   2. http credentials (username/password)   3. ssh credentials (privateKey/publicKey/knownHosts)

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Istio Package

ingressGateways.description: Ingress gateways are setup in a Horizontal Pod Autoscaler with 1 to 5 replicas Besides some ports needed by Istio, only ports 80 and 443 are opened Ingress gateways that require more configuration can be completed using `istio.values`

values.description: Values to passthrough to the istio-controlplane chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/istio-controlplane.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Istio Operator Package

values.description: Values to passthrough to the istio-operator chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/istio-operator.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Jaeger Package

client_id.description: OIDC Client ID to use for Jaeger

client_secret.description: OIDC Client Secret to use for Jaeger

enabled.description: Toggle SSO for Jaeger on and off

values.description: Values to pass through to Jaeger chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/jaeger.git

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Logging (EFK) Package

keyJSON.description: Elasticsearch license in json format seen here: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/elasticsearch-kibana#enterprise-license

trial.description: Toggle trial license installation of elasticsearch.  Note that enterprise (non trial) is required for SSO to work.

enabled.description: Toggle OIDC SSO for Kibana/Elasticsearch on and off. Enabling this option will auto-create any required secrets.

values.description: Values to passthrough to the elasticsearch-kibana chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/elasticsearch-kibana.git

enabled.description: Toggle deployment of Monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, and Alertmanager).

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Monitoring Package

enabled.description: Toggle SSO for monitoring components on and off

scopes.description: Grafana OIDC client scopes, comma separated, see https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/auth/generic-oauth/

values.description: Values to passthrough to the monitoring chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/core/monitoring.git

controlPlaneCidr.description: Control Plane CIDR, defaults to 0.0.0.0/0, use `kubectl get endpoints -n default kubernetes` to get the CIDR range needed for your cluster Must be an IP CIDR range (x.x.x.x/x - ideally with /32 for the specific IP of a single endpoint, broader range for multiple masters/endpoints) Used by package NetworkPolicies to allow Kube API access

enabled.description: Toggle all package NetworkPolicies, can disable specific packages with `package.networkPolicies.enabled`

registryCredentials.description: Single set of registry credentials used to pull all images deployed by BigBang.

auth_url.description: OIDC auth URL template string (to be used as default)

certificate_authority.description: Keycloak's certificate authority (unencoded) used by authservice to support SSO for various packages

client_id.description: OIDC client ID used for packages authenticated through authservice

client_secret.description: OIDC client secret used for packages authenticated through authservice

jwks.description: Keycloak realm's json web key uri, obtained through https://<keycloak-server>/auth/realms/<realm>/.well-known/openid-configuration

host.description: Domain for keycloak used for configuring SSO

token_url.description: OIDC token URL template string (to be used as default)

sso.description: Global SSO values used for BigBang deployments when sso is enabled, can be overridden by individual packages.

flux.description: Flux reconciliation overrides specifically for the Twistlock Package

values.description: Values to passthrough to the twistlock chart: https://repo1.dso.mil/platform-one/big-bang/apps/security-tools/twistlock.git
